intro: Grammitis tenuisecta, commonly known as the slender segmented fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that give it a lacy appearance. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rock crevices. Its small, clustered spore-producing structures are located on the underside of its leaves. Grammitis tenuisecta is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in high humidity and partial shade.
